sections.title: Context & Role in Aegis IAM
sections.goal: Understand the interviewee’s security engineering responsibilities, especially around enterprise SSO and least privilege in the context of Aegis IAM operations.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your day-to-day responsibilities in the Aegis IAM project?
How do you ensure compliance with POL-SEC-001 in the IAM context?
What are the key operational challenges in maintaining JIT access?

sections.title: Threat Modeling & Vulnerability Management
sections.goal: Explore how threat models are built for IAM and how vulnerabilities are prioritized and remediated.
sample_questions: How do you integrate threat modeling into the IAM change management process?
Can you describe a recent vulnerability you handled and the mitigation steps?
How do you decide between immediate patching versus scheduled remediation?

sections.title: Cross-Project Security Dependencies
sections.goal: Uncover dependencies between Aegis IAM and other Novereon Systems projects, such as Orion Edge Gateway and Poseidon Networking.
sample_questions: How does Aegis IAM integrate with Orion Edge Gateway’s auth components?
What security policies are enforced across IAM and Poseidon Networking?
Can you share an example where a change in another project affected IAM’s security posture?

sections.title: Incident Response & Runbooks
sections.goal: Examine how runbooks like RB-IAM-075 are applied in real incidents and how SLAs influence response.
sample_questions: How often have you had to use RB-IAM-075 in the last quarter?
What evidence do you collect during an access revocation emergency?
How do SLA-ORI-02 or SLA-HEL-01 indirectly affect IAM incident handling?

sections.title: Decision-Making & Risk Tradeoffs
sections.goal: Discuss complex tradeoffs in security decisions, balancing least privilege, operational velocity, and user experience.
sample_questions: Can you describe a situation where enforcing least privilege conflicted with operational needs?
How do you evaluate the risk of temporarily relaxing an access policy?
What evidence or metrics do you rely on to justify a security tradeoff?
